text: James Gaius Watt (January 31, 1938 - May 27, 2023) was an American lawyer and politician. He was United States Secretary of the Interior from 1981 to 1983. He was called an "anti-environmentalist". He was one of Ronald Reagan's most controversial cabinet appointments. Watt resigned after saying a controversial remark about affirmative action. In 1995, Watt was indicted on 18 counts of felony perjury and obstruction of justice for making false statements before a federal grand jury. He was sentenced to five years probation. Watt died on May 27, 2023 in Arizona at the age of 85. == References == ==Other websites== * Wolf, Ron. 1981. "God, James Watt, and the Public Land".
